SHOO_HELPTEXT: Leave the server, purging all configuration
PING_HELPTEXT: Asks AstralMod to reply with a message
NICK_HELPTEXT: Sets your nickname after staff have a chance to review it
NICK_PARAM1: The nickname you wish to be known as
SETLOCALE_HELPTEXT: Sets the language AstralMod will use when processing your commands
HELP_HELPTEXT: Acquire information about how to use AstralMod and any available commands
HELP_PARAM1:
*Optional Parameter*
The command to acquire information about.
If this parameter is not present, we'll list the available commands.
SUDO_HELPTEXT: Requests permission to use moderator commands for 5 minutes
RM_PARAM1: The number of messages to remove, or `all` to remove up to 100 messages within the past day
RM_PARAM2:
*Optional Parameter*
The user to delete messages from
CHNK_HELPTEXT: Sets a random nickname to user
CHNK_PARAM1:
- The User ID of the user to apply a new nickname to
- Mention of the user to apply a new nickname to
BLOCK_HELPTEXT: Blocks users from using a feature in the current channel
BLOCK_PARAM1:
*Optional Parameter*
The feature to block, or `all` for all commands. If no feature is specified, all *commands* will be blocked.
BLOCK_REMARKS:
Valid features are `spam`, `log` and any command, except for `block` and `unblock`.
`spam` will disable spam control in the channel, and `log` will disable log collection from the channel. Neither can be applied server-wide, and `log` cannot be blocked or unblocked in channels configured for storing logs.
UNBLOCK_HELPTEXT: Unblocks users from using a feature in the current channel
UNBLOCK_PARAM1:
*Optional Parameter*
The feature to unblock. If no feature is specified, all features will be unblocked.
EVAL_REMARKS: This can only be executed by the bot's owner
PIN_HELPTEXT: Portably pin a message for reference
PIN_PARAM1:
The message to pin; 1 for the last message sent in this channel, 2 for the second last message, etc.
You can also provide a message ID to pin.
PIN_AVAILABLEOPTIONS: `--view [id]` Lets you view that specific pin. Will also let you view any attachments in the pin
PIN_REMARKS: AstralMod pins messages by taking the message ID and channel ID. If the message is deleted or if the channel is deleted, the message will not be retrievable.
PINS_PARAM1:
*Optional Parameter*
The page number you wish to view
UNPIN_HELPTEXT: Removes a message from your portable pins
UNPIN_PARAM1: The number of the pin that you want to unpin. To get pin numbers, use `{{prefix}}pins`
PIC_PARAM1:
*Optional Parameter*
The user that you want to get the profile picture of. If no user is specified, your profile picture will be returned
SETUNIT_HELPTEXT: Sets the units that you prefer AstralMod to use
SETUNIT_REMARKS: If you want to set the language that you prefer AstralMod to use, use {{prefix}}setlocale.
SINFO_HELPTEXT: Retrieves miscellaneous information about the current server
CALC_HELPTEXT: Invokes theCalculator and calculates mathematical expressions
CALC_REMARKS: Multiple expressions can be evaluated consecutively by seperating them with a colon.
TR_PARAM1: The language to translate from. If omitted, the language is automatically detected.
TR_PARAM2: The language to translate to. If omitted, defaults to English.
UPTIME_HELPTEXT: Gets the amount of time AstralMod has been connected to discord
SETTINGSSIZE_HELPTEXT: Gets the approximate size of the AstralMod settings file in bytes
RETRSETTINGS_HELPTEXT: Retrieves the information AstralMod has stored about you
RESETSETTINGS_HELPTEXT: Deletes the information AstralMod has stored about you
SPAMCTL_HELPTEXT: Toggles whether AstralMod will control spam for this server
SPAMDATA_HELPTEXT: Queries AstralMod for information about your spam habits
SUGGEST_HELPTEXT: Sends a suggestion to the server
TIME_HELPTEXT: Gets the time at a specific place
TIME_PARAM1:
- Any UTC offset
- A timezone code known to AstralMod
- A user known to AstralMod that has set their time zone
- Any location known to AstralMod
SETTZ_PARAM1:
- Any UTC offset
- A timezone code known to AstralMod
- A user known to AstralMod that has set their time zone
- Any location known to AstralMod
SETTZ_REMARKS: By using this command, your timezone will be available to anyone who asks AstralMod.
TIMER_HELPTEXT: Sets a timer for the amount of time specified in time
TIMER_PARAM1:
- A number, in minutes
-A number followed by either `s`, `m`, `h`.
TIMER_PARAM2:
*Optional Parameter*
The text to be sent when timer expires.
TIMERS_HELPTEXT: Lists the timers you have running
RMTIMER_PARAM1: The index of the timer you wish to remove. This can be obtained with `{{prefix}}timers`.
UINFO_OPTION1: `--index [num]` Zero based index of user to query
UINFO_PARAM1: The user that you want to get the information of.
FETCHUSER_HELPTEXT: Adds a user to AstralMod's user store
FETCHUSER_PARAM1: The user ID you want to add to AstralMod's store.
FETCHUSER_REMARKS: AstralMod is only aware of users it's in servers with. You can use this commands to let AstralMod know about users from other servers so you can use commands like `uinfo` or `pic` on them.
FIND_HELPTEXT: Lets you search through all users in AstralMod's store
FIND_PARAM1: The user you want to find.
FIND_REMARKS: AstralMod will try and find the closest match to your query. By default, it will include users in servers AstralMod's with. You can use `fetchuser` to add to the user store.
DEAL_PARAM1: The user you want to manage.
WARN_HELPTEXT: Adds a warning to a user
LSWARN_HELPTEXT: Lists all the warnings for a user
LSWARN_PARAM1:
*Optional Parameter*
 The user to list the warnings of. If no user is supplied, it defaults to you.
RMWARN_HELPTEXT: Removes a warning from a user
RMWARN_PARAM1: The ID of the warning you want to remove.
RMWARN_PARAM2: The user that you want to remove the warning from.
WEATHER_HELPTEXT: Gets the weather at a location
WEATHER_PARAM1:
- A user whose location is known to AstralMod.
- A location known to AstralMod.
WEATHER_AVAILABLEOPTIONS: `--user [user]` Lets you get the weather of a user rather than a location.
WEATHER_REMARKS: You can set your preferred units using `{{prefix}}setunit`.
SETLOC_REMARKS: By using this command, your location will be available to anyone who asks AstralMod. To reduce privacy concerns, it's a good idea to enter the name of a large city near you or a city slightly offset from your actual location.
